New York University Archives
New York University Archives Collection of the Washington Square Journal
Washington Square Journal
RG.39.187
13.25 Linear Feet In 9 flat boxes and 12 reels of microfilm
1955-1973 This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Square Journal, later known as the Washington Square Journal, dating from 1955 to 1973. This newspaper documented student life at NYU (particuarly at the Washington Square campus), local and national news, campus living, and student clubs. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collections includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Arrangement
Newspapers are arranged chronologically.
Biographical / Historical
New York University has had many student newspapers since its founding. The University Heights campus and the Washington Square campus had separate student newspapers until 1973 when the University Heights campus was closed. The Washington Square Journal was preceded by the Washington Square Bulletin and succeeded by the Washington Square Daily News.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of the Washington Square Journal; RG 39.187; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains issues of student newspapers the Square Journal and Washington Square Journal dating from 1955-1973. The newspaper was printed daily and documented student life, university news, and local or international news with relevancy to NYU.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Researchers must consult microfilm copies due to the fragility of the original newspapers.
College student newspapers and periodicals. Student activities. New York University -- Athletics
